Package ohos.media.image

Class ImageSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.image.ImageSource

  • public class ImageSource
extends Object
    Describes image data sources used to share source data in a series of operations, such as image decoding.

    Applications can use this class to decode image.

    Create an ImageSource by calling create. Obtain basic image information by calling getImageInfo. Decode images by calling createPixelMap.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#IMAGE

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  ImageSource.DecodeEventListener
      Listens for the events occurred during image decoding.
      static class  ImageSource.DecodingOptions
      Provides image decoding options.
      static class  ImageSource.IncrementalSourceOptions
      Describes options of the incremental data source.
      static class  ImageSource.SourceInfo
      Describes image source information, including the image quantity and file format.
      static class  ImageSource.SourceOptions
      Describes image data source options, including the image format represented as image/png, for example.
      static class  ImageSource.UpdateMode
      Describes the update mode of the image data source.

      • create

        public static ImageSource create​(InputStream is,
                                 ImageSource.SourceOptions opts)
        Creates an ImageSource based on an input stream.

        This method takes an InputStream instance as the source where the image data derives from. The ImageSource instance to create cannot be used to obtain Exif information.

        Parameters:
        is - Indicates an input stream of the image data source.
        opts - Indicates data source options.
        Returns:
        Returns the ImageSource object if created; returns null if an exception occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • create

        public static ImageSource create​(byte[] data,
                                 int offset,
                                 int length,
                                 ImageSource.SourceOptions opts)
        Creates an ImageSource based on a byte array with specified offset and length.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the byte array containing the source data.
        offset - Indicates the offset into image data for where the reading begins.
        length - Indicates the image data size, in bytes.
        opts - Indicates data source options.
        Returns:
        Returns the ImageSource object if created; returns null if an exception occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the offset or length is invalid.
        Since:
        1

        Returns the ImageSource object if created; returns null if an exception occurs.

      • createPixelmap

        public PixelMap createPixelmap​(ImageSource.DecodingOptions opts)
        Decodes source image data and creates a pixel map.

        For a source containing multiple images, the image data of index 0 is decoded by default.

        Parameters:
        opts - Indicates image decoding options.
        Returns:
        Returns the image if the data is decoded; returns null if an exception occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • createPixelmap

        public PixelMap createPixelmap​(int index,
                               ImageSource.DecodingOptions opts)
        Decodes source image data based on a specified index location in the ImageSource and creates a pixel map.

        For a source containing multiple images, use an index to specify the image location.

        Parameters:
        index - Indicates an index specifying the image location. The index starts from 0.
        opts - Indicates image decoding options.
        Returns:
        Returns the image if the data is decoded; returns null if an exception occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • createThumbnailPixelmap

        public PixelMap createThumbnailPixelmap​(ImageSource.DecodingOptions opts,
                                        boolean allowFromImage)
        Decodes thumbnail data contained in the ImageSource instance to generate a thumbnail and creates a thumbnail pixel map.
        Parameters:
        opts - Indicates image decoding options.
        allowFromImage - Specifies whether to allow creation based on the original image if the ImageSource does not contain thumbnail data.
        Returns:
        Returns the created PixelMap if the decoding is successful; returns null if the decoding fails.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this ImageSource have been released.
        Since:
        2

      • updateData

        public boolean updateData​(byte[] data,
                          boolean isFinal)
        Updates incremental data to an image data source using a byte array.

        When incremental data is obtained, use this method to update source data. Input data requirements are described by UpdateMode.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the byte array inputting incremental data.
        isFinal - Indicates whether the data update is the last batch.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the source data is updated; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • updateData

        public boolean updateData​(byte[] data,
                          int offset,
                          int length,
                          boolean isFinal)
        Updates incremental data to an image data source using a byte array with specified offset and length.

        When incremental data is obtained, use this method to update source data. Input data requirements are described by UpdateMode.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the byte array inputting incremental data.
        offset - Indicates offset into image data for where the reading starts.
        length - Indicates the size of the incremental data, in bytes.
        isFinal - Indicates whether the data is the last batch.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is updated; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the offset or length is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • getImageInfo

        public ImageInfo getImageInfo​()
        Obtains basic image information.
        Returns:
        Returns the ImageInfo object if obtained; returns null otherwise. Note that the returned ImageInfo object contains only the ImageInfo.size of this ImageSource object. Other image information can be obtained only after image decoding.
        Since:
        1

      • getImageInfo

        public ImageInfo getImageInfo​(int index)
        Obtains basic information about the image at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the image index, which starts from 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the ImageInfo object if obtained; returns null otherwise. Note that the returned ImageInfo object contains only the ImageInfo.size of this ImageSource object. Other image information can be obtained only after image decoding.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • getImagePropertyInt

                                     String key,
                                     int defaultValue)

        Parameters:
        index - Indicates an index specifying the image location. The index starts from 0.
        key - Indicates a key defined in PropertyKey.
        defaultValue - Indicates the custom default value of the property key.

        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if key is null.

      • getThumbnailInfo

        public ImageInfo getThumbnailInfo​()
        Obtains basic information (such as the size) about the thumbnail from the ImageSource instance.

        Currently, only thumbnails in JPEG format can be identified.

        Returns:
        Returns the basic information if obtained; returns null if the thumbnail is not in JPEG format.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this ImageSource instance have been released.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the source image file does not contain a thumbnail.
        Since:
        4

      • getImageThumbnailBytes

        public byte[] getImageThumbnailBytes​()
        Obtains raw data of the thumbnail from the ImageSource instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the byte array containing the thumbnail data if the thumbnail exists.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this ImageSource instance have been released.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the source image file does not contain a thumbnail.
        Since:
        3

      • getThumbnailFormat

        public int getThumbnailFormat​()
        Obtains the format of the thumbnail from the ImageSource instance.

        Currently, only thumbnails in JPEG format can be identified.

        Returns:
        Returns ImageFormat.JPEG if the thumbnail is in JPEG format; returns ImageFormat.UNKNOWN otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this ImageSource have been released.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the source image file does not contain a thumbnail.
        Since:
        3

        Obtains image source information.
        Returns:
        Returns the image source information if obtained; returns null if an exception occurs.
        Since:

      • finalize

        protected void finalize​()
                 throws Throwable
        Description copied from class: Object
        Called by the garbage collector on an object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. A subclass overrides the finalize method to dispose of system resources or to perform other cleanup.

        The general contract of finalize is that it is invoked if and when the Java™ virtual machine has determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, except as a result of an action taken by the finalization of some other object or class which is ready to be finalized. The finalize method may take any action, including making this object available again to other threads; the usual purpose of finalize, however, is to perform cleanup actions before the object is irrevocably discarded. For example, the finalize method for an object that represents an input/output connection might perform explicit I/O transactions to break the connection before the object is permanently discarded.

        The finalize method of class Object performs no special action; it simply returns normally. Subclasses of Object may override this definition.

        The Java programming language does not guarantee which thread will invoke the finalize method for any given object. It is guaranteed, however, that the thread that invokes finalize will not be holding any user-visible synchronization locks when finalize is invoked. If an uncaught exception is thrown by the finalize method, the exception is ignored and finalization of that object terminates.

        After the finalize method has been invoked for an object, no further action is taken until the Java virtual machine has again determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, including possible actions by other objects or classes which are ready to be finalized, at which point the object may be discarded.

        The finalize method is never invoked more than once by a Java virtual machine for any given object.

        Any exception thrown by the finalize method causes the finalization of this object to be halted, but is otherwise ignored.

        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable - the Exception raised by this method
        See Also:
        WeakReference, PhantomReference
